Pour commencer il faut bien regarder ces 3 gars. Ils avaient de gauche Ã droite respectivement 20 ans, 18 ans et 19 ans le 7 Janvier 1978. "Keep your spirits clear and lucid, tear off the masks of your tormentors, and fanatically serve the truth. Our struggle began long ago, and what we have sown will not be uprooted, since the children of our children will reclaim the torch for the great glory of Christ. Remain strong and united. Do not fear death or your adversaries. Human works are temporary."Adrien Arcand Originally compiled and published by Reconquista Press in 2017, Serviam: The Political Ideology of Adrien Arcand presents an anthology of the beliefs of this great journalist, thinker, and leader. Arcand (1899â€“1967) led the Canadian fascist movement as a fervent Catholic and Quebecois. The selected speeches and writings within Serviam are not constrained merely to the French Canada of the 1930s through the 1960s, although his response to the competing contemporary ideas is present, but his responses are universal. Arcand concisely and clearly offers critiques of communism, liberalism, materialism, etc. out of love for his people and God. Both a fascist and Catholic, Arcand pulls no punches in critiquing the state of Canadian government and Church leadership. Adrien Arcand demonstrates in his writings that he is first and foremost a servant of God, which informs his entire political philosophy. The title Serviam (meaning "I will serve") refers to the cry of St. Michael made in response to the rebellious call of Satan, "non serviam" or "I will not serve." Complete with a preface, essay, and biography by three modern authors, Antelope Hill Publishing is proud to present Serviam: The Political Ideology of Adrien Arcand for the first time in English, translated from French by Dâ€™Entremont.[link]

Casal Bertone Ã¨ uno di quei quartieri della periferia romana che difficilmente vi verrebbe in mente di andare a cercare sulla mappa delle meraviglie di Roma. Uno di quei pezzi di una periferia abbandonata e lasciata a se stessa, grigia e senza spazi di socialitÃ , con pochi servizi, con caseggiati anonimi ereditÃ della speculazione edilizia selvaggia, dove ogni tanto spunta fuori qualche pazzesca chiesa in stile Mazinga buttata li fuori contesto come se fosse lo scarto di un gigante che grossomodo resta l'unico intervento pubblico degno di nota nel cemento urbano...A Casal Bertone si vive in una dimensione differente, quasi non fosse Roma, quasi fosse una cittÃ nella cittÃ , con una umanitÃ vivace che ancora cerca una dimensione di socialitÃ .Qui tanti anni fa Ã¨ nato il Circolo Futurista Casal Bertone, il CFCB, una costola di CP che ha espresso da subito una vocazione per l'arte, per la socialitÃ , per la cultura popolare, che ha saputo diventare un riferimento per il quartiere, riempiendo quel vuoto lasciato dalle istituzioni con mille attivitÃ , mille feste, mille mostre, con il CAF, con le raccolte sangue. Un punto di aggregazione incredibile, che ha stravolto il concetto classico di sezione, quasi una TAZ nascosta nelle pieghe della cittÃ ...Tutto questo oggi Ã¨ venuto meno stamattina con uno sgombero all'alba, condito con blindati, manganellate e lacrimogeni. Mera vendetta politica, puro pragmatismo stalinista... un potere quello dei compagni a Roma molto simile a quello dello sceriffo di Nottingham ha posto fine a tutto questo, semplicemente perchÃ¨ loro, a differenza di noi, sono spietati, non lasciano spazi e spiragli, specie se si sta facendo qualcosa di bello, se si sta dando quelle risposte che sulla carta (ma veramente Ã¨ mai stato cosÃ¬?) dovrebbero dare loro... Ma alla fine di questa vicenda, oltre la perdita, oltre l'amaro, resta l'esempio forte, l'idea che un mondo diverso si puÃ² costruire da subito, qui ed ora, un mondo che nessun potere o sotto-potere potrÃ mai togliere, perchÃ© vive nei cuori degli uomini liberi.CFCB per mille anni, e lunga vita ai sogni!...e ricordatevi, la tartaruga la casa se la porta appresso...RTP

Per nulla, risponde Guillaume Travers. Al contrario, essa ne Ã¨ il logico risultato. THE TOWERIt is a great thing to be alive during a time of great chaos, change, uncertainty and upheaval. The strength and fortitude of the tower is not tested save during the siege, and so it is with men.Those of worth will show the greatest resistance and resilience when faced with extreme pressure from without, and their walls will not crumble. More, they will act not only to defend themselves, but as a mighty fortress that protects all within its inner circle from the forces of darkness without. Do not simply survive the New Dark Ages. Conquer them.

Sabato 5 febbraioTRADIZIONE IN CAMMINOConferenza, cena e degustazione con sommelier Siamo lieti di annunciare - a grande richiesta - il ritorno delle giornate identitarie dedicate ai nostri retaggi millenari, al nostro modo di vivere e al nostro patrimonio eno-gastronomico.A partire dalle 18 - con Renato Romano e Guido Giraudo - parleremo delle Vie di pellegrinaggio e del viaggio come dimensione interiore: presenteremo "Giorno dopo giorno" - splendido diario sulla Via Francigena, recentemente pubblicato da Passaggio al Bosco Edizioni - e faremo una panoramica storica sui cammini che attraversano la nostra Firenze. A seguire, una bella cena comunitaria e una degustazione di "vini ancestrali" con il sommelier, tra curiositÃ , aneddoti e sapienze trasmesse. CASAGGÃŒ FIRENZE - VIA FRUSA 37

"Find your purpose," they say to men.Your shoulders are made for throwing accurately, with power. Your mind runs to problems, solutions and strategy. Your body is designed to carry you over long distances, ranging overland with speed. You are bigger than women, despite the high cost of making a bigger body. Your spirit seeks to challenge others, to dominate and win. Your purpose is war, son.King of All ThingsÂ outlines a view of life grounded in man's eternal relationship with combat. A unique blend of commentary, sourcebook and history, this book lays out a framework for men to acquaint themselves with their manifest purpose. Savage takes a sweeping view of history and culture to make his case, spanning millennia, from the art and culture of Ancient Greeks, to the symbols and men of the Vietnam War.Our ancestors took the prospect of war seriously; today, we foolishly think mankind can leave war behind. Men should heed the wisdom of their ancestors, and this book is a guide to that end; it outlines the development of mind, body and spirit for combat, including both actionable advice and explanatory theory. Savage pulls no punches in challenging your views on everything from the American soul to fitness culture. This book is what Savage wanted someone to press into his hands during his youth, with the simple instruction: "read this."

A people is not led according to its will; the democratic formula; nor according to the will of one individual: the dictatorial formula. But according to laws. I do not talk here of man-made laws. There are norms, natural laws of life; and there are norms, natural laws of death. Laws of life and laws of death. A nation is headed for life or death according to its respect for one or the other of these laws.Here are two opposite ideas, one containing truth, the other the lie. Truth - of which there can be but one - is sought. The question is put to a vote. One idea polls 10,000 votes, the other 10,050. Is it possible that 50 votes more or less determine or deny truth? Truth depends neither on majority nor minority; it has its own laws and it succeeds, as has been seen, against all majorities, even though they be crushing.Corneliu Zelea Codreanu
